author: Special Correspondent
text:
‘Repeated plea of Puducherry to write off Rs. 6,000 crore has been ignored’

People’s Welfare Front (PWF) on Thursday said the Union budget and the Railway budget have let down the smaller States and Union Territories while extending more favours to big barons and corporates.

Addressing reporters here, Communist Party of India (CPI) local unit secretary and convener of PWF R.Viswanathan said it is highly condemnable that Chief Minister N.Rangasamy has not said anything on the budgets.

The Union government reduced allocation for rural employment guarantee programme and integrated child health schemes.

“While pampering private industrial barons with concessions or waiver of dues, the Modi government has been turning a deaf ear to the repeated plea of Puducherry for writing off more than Rs. 6,000 crore of the Union Territory. A single industrialist has been extended waiver but the Union Territory, having more than 12 lakh people, has been left in the lurch,” said Mr. Viswanathan.

PWF plans protest

The PWF would hold a demonstration near the head post office here on Saturday to condemn the booking of sedition cases against the CPI, CPI (M) leaders, AICC vice-president Rahul Gandhi, Chief Minister of Delhi Arvind Kejriwal among other Opposition leaders in connection with Jawaharlal Nehru University incident.

The PWF would also hold a demonstration on March 7 to criticise the Puducherry government for its “various failures” in Villianur.

Mr. Viswanathan also said the parties in the PWF have started seat-sharing talks.
title: CPI leader slams Rangasamy’s silence on Union, Rly. budgets
